fields.name: Post Doctoral Degree
fields.description: Post-Doctoral research is an academic research carried by Doctoral Scholars (students) who have completed their doctoral studies. Postdoctoral fellows can retrieve some of the suitable resources in their areas of interest and will help them in building collaborative relations with miscellaneous universities. Following are some the available Post-Doctoral Degree Programs.

fields.name: Bachelor's Degree
fields.description: Our students, whether 25, 35, or 55 years old, have chosen the programs to complement their active professional lives or creative pursuits. The range in age, background, and life experience creates an engaging learning environment that sets the stage for international graduate college admission, rewarding careers, and personal enrichment.

fields.name: Master's Degree
fields.description: Universidad Azteca offers a variety of Master Degree, the study offers are open via branch campus programs or as joint programs. Master Degrees are awarded by a Azteca University upon completion of a specific course of study. Students obtain a Master’s Degree to further their studies in a specialized field and to gain highly developed skills in analysis and critical thinking

fields.name: Doctoral Degree
fields.description: The highest level of education a student can receive is a doctoral degree. These advanced degrees indicate that the recipient has in-depth knowledge and mastery of their particular area of study, and they’re relatively rare, don’t expect this level of education to become as common as bachelor’s degrees or even master’s degrees.

fields.name: Doctor of Letters (D.Litt., Litt.D., D. Lit., or Lit. D. ) Degree
fields.description: Doctor of Letters (D.Litt., Litt.D., D. Lit., or Lit. D. ) Degree in the disciplines of Business, Humanities, Social Sciences, Design, Creative Arts and other related areas;

fields.name: Doctor of Laws, (LL.D.) Degree
fields.description: Doctor of Laws, (LL.D.) Degree in the discipline of Law and other related areas to a candidate whose work and research have made distinct contributions to the advancement of knowledge.

fields.heading: ELIGIBILITY FOR D.S.C.
fields.description: A candidate who is awarded Doctor of Philosophy (Ph.D.) degree in the disciplines of Science, Engineering, Technology and other related areas by Azteca University or degree recognized equivalent thereto from any other university may present his/her candidacy for the degree of Doctor of Science (D.Sc.) provided he/she must have:

fields.heading: ELIGIBILITY FOR D.Litt.
fields.description: A candidate who is awarded Doctor of Philosophy (Ph.D.) degree in the disciplines of Business, Humanities, Social Sciences, Design, Creative Arts and other related areas by Azteca University or degree recognized equivalent thereto from any other University may present his/her candidacy for the Doctor of Literature (D.Litt.) provided that he/she

fields.heading: ELIGIBILITY FOR L.L.D.
fields.description: A candidate who is awarded Doctor of Philosophy (Ph.D.) degree in the discipline of Law and related areas by this Azteca University or degree recognized equivalent thereto from any other University may present his/her candidacy for the Doctor of Laws (LL.D.) provided that he/she has:

fields.content: Minimum 2 years post Ph.D. teaching experience and has published 10 research papers indexed journals as first author or corresponding author OR

Have post Ph.D. experience of more than 2 years in the discipline of law and related areas, at least three recommendations/referrals of his work or contribution from nationally/internationally recognized experts of concerned field and his/her work and efforts has made distinct contributions to the society in the field of law.

Done post-doctoral work in Business, Humanities, Social Sciences, Design, Creative Arts and other related areas for a minimum period of 2 years and has published 10 research papers in Scopus indexed journals as first author or corresponding author.

Post Ph.D. experience of more than 2 years in Business, Humanities, Social Sciences, Design, Creative Arts and other related areas, at least three recommendations/ referrals of his research/ contribution from nationally/ internationally recognized experts of concerned field and his/her work and efforts has made distinct contributions to the society and advancement of knowledge.

Done post-doctoral work in Science, Engineering, Technology and other related areas for a minimum period of 2 years and have published 10 research papers or indexed journals as first or corresponding author

Post Ph.D. experience of more than 2 years in Science, Engineering, Technology and other related areas, 2 patents (at least 1 international patent) in relevant discipline and his/her research work and efforts should have national and international recognition and have made a distinct contribution to the society and advancement of knowledge. OR

Post Ph.D. experience of more than 2 years in Science, Engineering, Technology and other related areas, at least three recommendations/ referrals of his research or contribution from nationally/ internationally recognized experts in the concerned field and his/her work and effort which should have made a distinct contribution to the society and advancement of knowledge.

fields.heading: NOTIFICATION
fields.description: If UA is notified of cancellation within 3 calendar days after midnight of the day on which the Enrollment Agreement is signed, 85% money paid to UA will be refunded. (15% commission for administrative purposes).

fields.heading: PROCESSING
fields.description: From three (3) calendar days after midnight of the day on which the enrollment agreement is signed and until the University receives a student’s first completed assignment, within the enrollment period, the University is entitled to the following registration processing fee if the student cancels enrollment.

fields.heading: FINAL ACTION
fields.description: After the University receives the first completed assignment and until the student requests cancellation, the University will be entitled to registration fee and the following charges:

fields.content: After completing more than 10% of the total module assignments and up to and including completion of 25% of the assignments, 25% of the refundable tuition.
After completing more than 25% of the total module assignments and up to and including completion of 50% of the assignments, 10% of the refundable tuition.

If the student completes more than half of the total module assignments or the enrollment period has expired, the school will be entitled to the full tuition and no refund will be able. The amount of the module completed will be the ratio of completed assignments received by the University to the total assignments required to complete the module.
For students making rebated transfer degree and credits from an appointed institutions will not receive refund after 7 days of payment

Undergraduate, Graduate and Postgraduate Degree Programmes entitled Thesis Research or Credit Transfer modality at international programmes no refund is available after 7 business days of payment and the issue of Evaluation Report.

fields.heading: ACCEPTANCE POLICIES
fields.content: Other than in exceptional circumstances, a candidate for the Degree of D.Sc. / D.Litt./ or LL.D. shall be a graduate of Universidad Azteca or a recognized university.

fields.heading: ACCEPTANCE POLICIES
fields.content: No candidate shall present himself or herself for the D.Sc. / D.Litt./ or LL.D. until at least eight years after graduation to his or her first undergraduate degree.

fields.heading: ACCEPTANCE POLICIES
fields.content: The Degrees of D.Sc. / D.Litt./ or LL.D. shall be awarded for an original contribution (or contributions) of special excellence to linguistics, literary, philosophical, social or historical knowledge.

fields.heading: ACCEPTANCE POLICIES
fields.content: The Degree shall be awarded only on work, whether sole or conjoint, published in book form or in scholarly journals in general circulation.

fields.heading: ACCEPTANCE POLICIES
fields.content: No work shall be considered for the Degree if the work, or major portion thereof, has previously formed the basis of an award of any degree or diploma in this or any other university.

fields.heading: ACCEPTANCE POLICIES
fields.content: A candidate shall make application in writing to be examined, and such application, accompanied by the Post-Doctoral Tuition Fees, together with

fields.heading: ACCEPTANCE POLICIES
fields.content: Thesis Proposal to be examined and approved

fields.heading: ACCEPTANCE POLICIES
fields.content: A statutory declaration which shall:

fields.heading: ACCEPTANCE POLICIES
fields.content: State the extent to which the work is the candidate’s own, and (in the case of a conjoint work) identify as clearly as possible which parts are the candidate’s own

fields.heading: ACCEPTANCE POLICIES
fields.content: State what portion (if any) of the work submitted has been previously presented for a degree or diploma of Universidad Azteca or any other university,

OUR MISSION
fields.content: Azteca University is an Institution of Higher Education, Humanist, Christian, and inspired by the Life of Saint Jean-Baptiste de La Salle, whose mission is the integral and Self-realization of human being, educating people with values and the highest academic level, capable to promote a positive environment of which they belong.

fields.heading: OUR VISION
fields.content: Azteca University must be a decisive factor in the economic, political, social and cultural development of Mexico, and the world, through its educational services, in its different modalities, seeking the excellence of its Alumni, to produce significant impacts in scientific and technological knowledge, understanding their social environment and capable to protect the truth, maintaining the highest Spirit of Self-improvement and service.

fields.name: Dr. José Agustín Lopéz Gónzalez Pacheco
fields.content:
Welcome to Universidad Azteca, Division of International Programs! If you are a prospective student for undergraduate, graduate, professional or continuing studies, I hope you will explore our Website to learn more about the international academic programs we offer, as well as the many services and activities we make available for our students. We are a university focused on the individual, offering each student a life plan that allows discovering human potential and how to focus for his/her benefits. We let students find their paths, giving meaning to their lives and conduct their work based on the principles of humanism and inspiration building their lives with the values of truth, justice and honesty.

The University offers the means to carry out a comprehensive education; we promote a transcending daily learning, providing tools to empower your professional and personal life. With advances in technology drawing the world closer and closer together, international students play an increasingly vital part in the internationalization of the academic mission of our Universidad Azteca, International students enrich the learning experience by allowing all of us – students, faculty, staff and administrators – to interact with people from diverse cultural backgrounds. I hope our Website and this brief message provided you with a glimpse of what the Universidad Azteca can offer international students. We are a dynamic institution that welcomes to international community of diverse backgrounds in the belief that their respectful interaction advances the discovery of truth, mutual understanding, self-realization and the common good. I encourage you to learn more about us. Talk to one of our students. Chat with a professor or Department Director & Chair. Explore our Web site. Find out how Universidad Azteca International Network System is helping others and how we can help you grow, achieve and succeed.

fields.heading: ACCREDITATION
fields.content:
Universidad Azteca is a Private University with Recognition of the Official Validity of Studies awarded by the Federal Ministry of Education of the Republic and recognized by the Federal Government (SECRETARIA DE EDUCACION PUBLICA, SEP) to award University degrees. The university offers Three Academic Systems: Traditional (on-campus), Blended Learning and Virtual E-learning (in a real time) and awards degrees in a variety of specializations study areas.

Azteca University periodically conducts a self-evaluation of international distance study programs in accordance with the standards of the ODLQC Open & Distance Learning Quality Council, (British) Azteca University have been Audited and Certified by AFQ Akademie Futurum Qualitas (Berlin, Germany) according to: ISO 9001:2015 QUALITY MANAGEMENT SYSTEMS ISO 29990:2010 LEARNING SERVICES FOR NON-FORMAL EDUCATION AND TRAINING Azteca University has received the "Mexican Institution of the Year 2013" Award during the VI Edition of the Mexico Quality Summit organized by the Latin American Quality Institute (LAQI), thus obtaining recognition for its delivery to quality and innovation in Mexico.

In addition to the aforementioned ISO Certifications, Azteca has several international accreditations that guarantee the quality and excellence of the higher education it offers, within these accreditations is:

Institutional and Programmatic Accreditation by TRACCERT, Training Accreditation & Certification Organization Canada. TRACCERT is a member of AAAC Association of Accrediting Agencies of Canada and a registered Accreditation and Certification Body with the Government of Canada.
Azteca University is certified by the LAQI Latin American Quality Institute in Quality Management System, receiving the Global Quality Certification by the Latin American Quality Institute (LAQI).
Universidad Azteca European Programmes at Austria is registered by THE AGENCY FOR QUALITY ASSURANCE AND ACCREDITATION AQ, AUSTRIA.
Azteca University has been registered and listed at Berlin Ministry of Education at Germany
Universidad Azteca European Programmes is an approved member of the European Association for Distance Learning EADL of United Kingdom.

From 2013 to 2017, Azteca University received the accreditation as “PREMIER PROVIDER” status by ASIC, Accreditation Service for International Colleges, Schools & Universities, based in the UK, is a UK Border Agency recognised Accreditation Body, a member of the British Quality Foundation (BQF), sits on the Quality Standards Group of UK NARIC, is listed in the international registry for the UK of CHEA, the US Council for Higher Education Accreditation, and is a national UK Affiliate of ENQA, the European Network of Quality Assurance for Higher Education, which recognizes ASIC as a bona fide quality assurance agency. This accreditation expired; in the meantime we are working on a different UK accrediting agency.

fields.heading: The outcome of a successful program accreditation at our Canadian Accrediting Agency may include one or more of the following:
Other Functions of our National Recognition and our Canadian Accreditation:

In any event, “Accreditation” is a voluntary process that gives public recognition to institutions that meet certain standards. It is a promise that an institution will provide the quality of education it claims to offer and provide consumer protection.

Accreditation assures the student that the institution operates on a sound financial basis, has an approved program of study, qualified instructors, adequate facilities and equipment, effective recruitment and admission policies, and advertises its courses truthfully.

Accreditation assures the student that the institution operates on a sound financial basis, has an approved program of study, qualified instructors, adequate facilities and equipment, effective recruitment and admission policies, and advertises its courses truthfully.

fields.listItem: Graduates are able to practice as a professional in a specific field, and in some cases receive a license to practice that is required by law;
Graduates are granted exemption from all or part of professional exams.
Graduates are eligible for entry to membership of a professional association or learned society.
The programme is confirmed as meeting externally designated standards and quality.
Verifying that an institution or program meets established standards.
Assisting Students in determining the acceptability of transfer credits.

fields.name: Ricardo R. Saavedra Hidalgo
fields.description:
Director and Legal representative of “Universidad Azteca International Network System” and Founder and General Director of “Pro-Innovation Solutions SC”, a consulting firm that provides service to transnational corporations, universities, governments and organizations in different countries like Mexico, United States, European Union, Malaysia, China, Taiwan, Bolivia, Peru, Honduras, Dominican Republic, Nicaragua and Costa Rica.

He has more than 19 years of experience as business consultant, with several executive positions worldwide. He has implemented successful operation in national and international companies and organizations. He has implemented educational technology, successful administrative design, application of acceleration models and innovation, setting out diagnosis and design of organizational structure. He has also created maps of leadership and integration of effective corporate team work. He is a consultant member for United Nations for more than 9 years; he also collaborates with UNESCO and DPI NGO Section at UN.

fields.name: Prof. Dr. Gerhard Berchtold,
fields.qualification: PGDipEDM, MBA, MPA, MA, LLM, PhD
fields.description:
Director of Business School Direct, Innsbruck, Austria the European Branch Center representative of Universidad Azteca, an Austrian scholar, management consultant, environmental policy advisor and businessman he is experienced in higher education provision and management.

Since the 1980ies, Professor Berchtold has held a wide range of professional management and policy management experience, as well as distance education management and lecturing, research and consulting experiences. He has served the Austrian national Parliament and the European Parliament as consultant and assistant, was a full-vote member of the Austrian Superfund Commission (Altlastensanierungskommission), he used to be the administrative and political director of a fraction of the Tirol State Legislature. He has won awards including the Austrian annual prize for environment and public administration proposals, Oekomanager 2000, and is also a Salzburg Seminar alumnus (Environment and Diplomacy, 1994). He has published numerous publications and contributed substantially to both, international business at the operational level in terms of projects, facilities and technologies. Professor Berchtold has linguistic proficiency in German, English, Italian, Spanish and French.

Author of more than 10 stories, two full length Drama and one Novel approved by the Government of Kerala for purchase by all School Libraries. All are free translations from Tamil.

fields.name: Prof. Dr. Christa Zuberbühler
fields.description: Christa Zuberbühler vereint durch ihre akademische Ausbildung Technik-Wirtschaft-Psychologie und wird zur Praxis ausgerichteten Unternehmensberaterin und zertifizierten Wirtschaftstrainerin. Sie ist seit vielen Jahren Beraterin für technische und wirtschaftliche Problemstellungen. Außerdem ist sie Sachbuchautorin, eingetragene Mediatorin und Lehrmediatorin weil sie u.a. die WirtschaftsMediation als die Methode erkennt, brach liegende Kreativitätspotenziale ihrer Kunden zu wecken und lösungsorientiert zu bündeln.

fields.name: Prof. Zemeer Nayar Padikkal
fields.description: Zemeer Nayar Padikkal, he is specialized in Institutional relations at the International level, implementing a network of institutions in Asia and Middle East. Consultant for International companies in Dubai dealing with Waste Management System, Information Technology and Property Management. He has more than 15 years experience in Educational Consultancy.

fields.name: Dr. Ruchi Doshi
fields.designation: IEEE Senior Member and Chair, IEEE WIE   Professor, Computer Science and Engineering
fields.description:
Dr. Ruchi Doshi is having more than 12 years of academic, research, and software development experience in Asia and Africa. Currently, she is working as a Research Professor at the Azteca University, Mexico, and Adjunct Professor at the Jyoti Vidyapeeth Women’s University, Jaipur, Rajasthan, India. She worked in the BlueCrest University College, Liberia, West Africa as Registrar and Head, Examination; BlueCrest University College, Ghana, Africa; Amity University, Rajasthan, India; Trimax IT Infrastructure & Services, Udaipur, India.

She is nominated from the IEEE Headquarter, USA for the Chair, Women in Engineering (WIE) and Secretary Position in Liberia country. She worked with the Ministry of Higher Education (MoHE) in Liberia and Ghana for the Degree approvals and accreditations processes. She is interested in the field of Machine Learning and Cloud computing framework development. She has published 20 research papers in peer-reviewed international journals and conferences; 2 Indian Patents; 3 books on Cloud Computing, Mobile Cloud computing, and Intelligent IoT Systems for Big Data Analysis. She is a Reviewer, Advisor, Ambassador, and Editorial board member of various reputed International Journals and Conferences with IEEE, Springer, and Elsevier bodies. She is an active member in organizing many international seminars, workshops, and conferences in India, Ghana, and Liberia.

fields.criteria: PURPOSE OF THE INVESTIGATION. ( Research: Purpose)
fields.hundread: CLEAR PURPOSE AND ORIGINAL IDEA (Purpose is clear; original ideas)
fields.ninety: CLEAR THESIS, SOME INDEPENDENT THINKING. (Clear thesis; some independent thought)
fields.eighty: THE THESIS IS RECOGNIZED BUT LACKS ORIGINAL PURPOSE. (Recognizable thesis but lacks of original, significant purpose)
fields.seventy: THE THESIS IS RECOGNIZED BUT LACKS ORIGINAL PURPOSE. (Recognizable thesis but lacks of original, significant purpose)
fields.fail: IT DOES NOT HAVE A CLEAR PURPOSE. FREQUENTLY DOES NOT RESPOND CORRECTLY TO THE SUBJECT. (No clear purpose; often does not correctly respond to the assignment)

fields.hundread: THE THESIS IS imaginatively, logically and precisely developed; analysis guides development , ANALYSIS GUIDES DEVELOPMENT (Thesis is imaginatively, logically and precisely developed; analysis guides development)
fields.ninety: THE EXAMPLES SUPPORT THE THESIS IN A LOGICAL AND ORDERLY FORM; ANALYSIS PREDOMISES BUT FALLS IN NARRATIVE. (Examples support the thesis in an orderly and logical fashion; analysis predominates, but some descents into narrative)
fields.eighty: ADEQUATE DEVELOPMENT; SOME EVIDENCE OF ANALYSIS BUT THE NARRATIVE GUIDES THE DEVELOPMENT. (Adequate development; some evidence of analysis, but narrative guides development)

fields.hundread: WELL ORGANIZED NOT MECHANICAL OR TAX. (Well organized; not mechanical or imposed)
fields.ninety: CLEARLY AND LOGICALLY ORGANIZED SOME FORCED TRANSITIONS. (Clearly, logically organized; transitions are sometimes strained)
fields.eighty: ORGANIZED; PREDICTABLE, MECHANIZED SEQUENCE ( Organized; predictable, mechanical sequence)
fields.seventy: SOME EVIDENCE OF ORGANIZATION BUT NOT CLEARLY FOLLOWED. (Some evidence of organization; not clearly followed)
fields.fail: THERE IS NO APPARENT PRINCIPLE OF ORGANIZATION; THERE IS NO RATIONALITY IN THE PARAGRAPHS. (No apparent principle of organization; no apparent rationale for paragraphing)

fields.hundread: REFERENCES TO THE MATERIAL ARE SIGNIFICANT AND APPROPRIATELY RELATED TO THE PURPOSE. (References to materials are appropriate and significantly related to purpose)
fields.ninety: MOST OF THE REFERENCES TO THE MATERIAL ARE ADEQUATE AND RELATED TO THE THESIS. (Most references to materials are appropriate and related to thesis)
fields.eighty: THE REFERENCES TO THE MATERIALS ARE APPROPRIATE BUT NOT RELATED TO THE THESIS. (References to materials are appropriate but not always related to thesis)
fields.seventy: FEW REFERENCES TO MATERIALS; THE REFERENCES ARE FEW TIMES RELATED TO THE THESIS. (Few references to materials; references seldom related to thesis)
fields.fail: THERE ARE NO REFERENCES TO THE MATERIALS OR THOSE THAT EXIST ARE IRRELEVANT. (No references to materials or references are irrelevant)

fields.hundread: PRAYERS ARE VARIED BOTH IN LENGTH AND STRUCTURE.
fields.eighty: FEW ERRORS IN THE STRUCTURE OF THE PRAYERS; SOME VARIATIONS IN LENGTH AND STRUCTURE.
fields.seventy: ERRORS IN THE STRUCTURE OF SENTENCES; THERE ARE NO VARIATIONS IN LENGTH AND STRUCTURE.
fields.fail: FREQUENT ERRORS IN THE STRUCTURE OF SENTENCES; IN SOME CASES NO UNDERSTANDING OF THE BASIC GRAMMAR STRUCTURE IS OBSERVED.

fields.hundread: CONCRETE AND APPROPRIATE WORDS USED CORRECTLY. THE DICTION IS ADEQUATE AND MATURE; COLLOQUIALISMS, CLICHES OR EXPRESSIONS ARE NOT USED.
fields.ninety: THE CHOICE OF WORDS IS GENERALLY ACCURATE; THE WRITER CHOOSES EFFECTIVE AND ACCURATE WORDS INSTEAD OF AUTOMATIC CHOICE.
fields.eighty: THE CHOICE OF WORDS IS GENERALLY ADEQUATE; THE VOCABULARY IS LIMITED IN NUMBER AND IN SOME CASES THE WORDS ARE ABSTRACT AND INACCURATE.
fields.seventy: THE WORDS USED ARE VAGUE AND INACCURATE. THEY ARE BASED ON COLLOCHIALISMS AND LOCAL GERGA.
fields.fail: WORDS THAT SHOULD BE IN THE RANK OF COLLEGE STUDENTS ARE MISUSE OR MISUSE.

fields.hundread: PRACTICALLY FREE OF MECHANICAL AND GRAMMATICAL ERRORS.
fields.ninety: THE MECHANICS IS GENERALLY CORRECT; SOME PROBLEMS WITH COMPLEX GRAMMAR AS WELL AS WITH POINTING SIGNS.
fields.eighty: SOME SYNTACTIC ERRORS, IN REFERENCE TO PRONOUNS, SPELLING AND POINTS.
fields.seventy: FREQUENT SYNTACTIC ERRORS, IN REFERENCE TO PRONOUNS, SPELLING AND POINTING AS WELL AS ERRORED SENTENCES.
fields.fail: FREQUENT MISTAKES IN SPELLING, SYNTAX AND OTHER ERRORS THAT DIFFICULT TO UNDERSTAND WHAT IS WRITTEN.

fields.heading: Office of the Registrar’s Files.
fields.content: The registrar is responsible for maintaining files that contain official transcripts of work performed by students at other institutions, official transcripts, and copies of occasional letters written by faculty and administration along with student replies. These letters generally are about academic programs, examinations, fellowships, etc. In addition, there are records of students’ progress in their programs. Members of the faculty and administration have access to these files for use in student advisement. Also, the university transcript clerks have access to the files in order to maintain them and to provide authorized data to authorized persons.

fields.heading: Department Files.
fields.content: Each Dean and Programme Coordinator is responsible for maintaining files that contain essentially the ame kinds of material as the registrar’s files. These separate files are maintained for the convenience of the departments and are used in advising students. Members of the faculty in each department and the department staff have access to these files.

fields.heading: Credential Files
fields.content: At the request of students, the Office of Career Services and Corporate Relations maintains files containing evaluations from faculty and staff of Universidad Azteca and other institutions attended either for Dual Degree Programmes or Credit Transfers, confidential letters of recommendation written by referees for the benefit of the students, and papers that students have prepared themselves. In addition to the Director & Chair, the staff of the Office of the Registrar and Dean of European Programmes has access to these files to carry out the work of the office.

fields.heading: Admissions Files.
fields.content: The Admissions Office staff is responsible for maintaining files that contain letters of recommendation for admission to U.Azteca, transcripts of work performed at other institutions, scores of examinations that may be required by various departments, and the student’s statement of purpose. All materials submitted become the property of the University. The admissions office staff and members of the admissions committees of the various departments also have access to these files for the purpose of carrying out the admissions function. After a student has been admitted to Universidad Azteca and actually registered for study here, these files are transferred to the Registrar.

fields.heading: Financial Files.
fields.content: The Department of Finance is responsible for maintaining files that contain applications, academic compliance and tuition fees invoices, scholarships and information regarding awards from previous institutions. The Department of Finance staff has access to these files in order to process invoices, payment confirmation and scholarships.

fields.heading: Dean of European Program Files.
fields.content: The Dean of European Programmes is responsible for maintaining files that contain background information and official documents about alleged student misconduct, disciplinary hearings, and student grievances. Information about student misconduct, alleged misconduct, and student grievances is considered to be confidential and is divulged on a strict «need-to-know» basis. The Chancellor (Rector) Director & Chair of International Programmes (Dir. Enlace International), Vice-Chancellor (Vice-Rector)  and their administrative staffs have access to the files for the purpose of conducting necessary investigation of charges, administering disciplinary or grievance hearings, and maintaining institutional records of such hearings.

fields.heading: Student Billing Files.
fields.content: The Student Billing Office is responsible for maintaining files that contain payment contracts, student and third party payments, authorizations to charge or reverse charges, correspondence with the student and with third party sponsors, collections information and bankruptcy documentation

fields.content: A training proposal covering: Teachers, students, curriculums and programs, authorities, administrative, educational service providers, their employees, and family accompaniment.
Educational content based on Humanism, competency training, meaningful learning and constructivism.
Workshops, spiritual activities and tutoring
Various degree modalities
Appropriate teaching material and orientation of the Social Service and Professional Practices.

fields.heading: School Learnings
fields.content: It is characterized by direct contact between the Teaching Advisor through face-to-face sessions and with the support of the Azteca Virtual Classroom.

fields.heading: Mixed Learnings
fields.content: It combines directed learning under the conduct of an Advisory Teacher (with face-to-face sessions, at least twice a week), and open and independent learning with the support of the Azteca Virtual Classroom.

fields.heading: Non-Schooled Learning
fields.content: It is done in line with the support of the Aztec Virtual Classroom and Teaching Advisors (with one face-to-face session per week), involves discipline and good study habits, relying on self-learning guides.

fields.heading: philosophy
fields.content: Azteca University is an institution of high academic quality, based on experience learning that is inspired by Christian humanist thought, philosophy and pedagogical work of San Juan Bautista De La Salle.

fields.heading: mission
fields.content: The Aztec University, based on Lasallian Christian humanism, has as its Mission the integral realization of the human being, training people in knowledge, skills, attitudes and values, with a high academic level capable of promoting the Common Good.

fields.heading: vision
fields.content: Azteca University is a decisive factor in cultural, economic, political and social development, through its educational services, with graduates of excellence producing improvements in its environment and significant advances in humanist, scientific and technological knowledge, capable of fighting for the truth, maintaining a spirit of improvement and service.

fields.heading: Principles
fields.content:
We believe that the University should be open to anyone I want to form fully and promote the Common Good.

We believe that the University has a vocation to the research of truth and the unity of knowledge in the diversity of positions.

We believe in Jesus Supreme Image of God before men and Supreme Image of Man before God.

We profess the principles of Catholicism respecting those who do not part of them, demanding respect for them, respect for our own.

We believe that only thought-free men and women are able to transcend.

We believe in Man as a principle, and in the dignity of the person as the origin and purpose of every culture.

We believe in the family as the main cell of society and the first former of the human being.

We believe in eertiallearning, as a process of integral development of the person and transformation of societies.

We believe that science leads us to Truth.

We believe in the complementarity of the truths of Reason and the truths of Faith.

fields.heading: School Learnings
fields.content: It is characterized by direct contact between the Teaching Advisor through face-to-face sessions and with the support of the Azteca Virtual Classroom.

fields.heading: Mixed Learnings
fields.content: It combines directed learning under the conduct of an Advisory Teacher (with face-to-face sessions, at least twice a week), and open and independent learning with the support of the Azteca Virtual Classroom.

fields.heading: Non-Schooled Learning
fields.content: It is done in line with the support of the Aztec Virtual Classroom and Teaching Advisors (with one face-to-face session per week), involves discipline and good study habits, relying on self-learning guides.
A clear idea of what you want to achieve with the student (Student Profile).
An Educational Community with teachers attentive to the needs of students (Educator Profile).
A fraternal way to accompany the student (Accompaniment and Mediation).
A relevant, innovative and quality curriculum, which is constantly evaluated.
An efficient Institutional Organization.

fields.heading: ACADEMIC FREEDOM
fields.content: Universidad Azteca fosters plurality of thought and cultural diversity and, thus, its faculty’s academic freedom. This right implies fulfilling the academic programs in effect and observing the established research norms. Academic freedom is understood as: The freedom to teach, this is, a professor’s right to present the results of his/her research findings and studies, and the different schools of thought and analysis relevant to the discipline. The freedom to perform research, in agreement with Universidad Azteca mission’s aim, and to publish its findings. Academic freedom implies the responsibility to refrain from using research as a proselytizing instrument in favor of any ideological, religious or political group.

fields.heading: EQUAL EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITY AND CONTINUOUS EMPLOY
fields.content: Universidad Azteca is an equal opportunity employer with non-discrimination policies and absence of racial, gender, creed or social preference. However, applicants must demonstrate the professional and moral standards required for the position, as well as comply with the institutional principles, norms and policies in effect. Continuous employment is subject to the fulfillment of the same conditions.

fields.heading: EQUAL ENROLLMENT AND ATTENDANCE STANDARDS..
fields.content:
Universidad Azteca pledges to equal opportunity and non-discrimination policies with absence of racial, gender, creed or social preference. However, students must agree to comply with the admission requirements and institutional principles, norms and policies in effect. Continuous attendance is subject to the fulfillment of the same conditions.
Universidad Azteca seeks to foster social mobility through its financial aid programs and scholarship funds, made available to high-achieving students with proven economic need. Social mobility is also promoted through the creation of educational models aimed at reducing the education gap in target regions or countries.

fields.heading: Undergraduate Programs
fields.subHeading: Candidates of all undergraduate degree programs must: Submit a 1-2 page typed narrative outlining one’s intent (e.g., reasons for undertaking a college degree, professional aspirations, etc.).

fields.heading: GRADUATE ADMISSIONS
fields.subHeading: Candidates of all undergraduate degree programs must: Submit a 1-2 page typed narrative outlining one’s intent (e.g., reasons for undertaking a college degree, professional aspirations, etc.).

fields.heading: MANDATORY GRADUATE DEGREE CANDIDATE INTERVIEW
fields.subHeading: Most Master and Doctoral applications include an interview of some sort. This allows us to discuss the Doctoral Degree particulars with you in more detail.

We will ask you about your background, goals and project, we will discuss how Azteca University can help you achieve your professional goals at Doctoral Levels. Once Azteca University has invited you for an interview it’s a safe bet that we think you can complete Graduate Program. This makes the interview an important part of your Graduate application. Your interview will be an important part of your postgraduate research application. This is your chance to meet your prospective Department, discuss your project and show your potential as an Academic Researcher. Please confirm the best date and time for you, and tell us your local time zone, we have elite of Graduate and Post-Graduate Students all around the world; please confirm your City and –country of Residence.
Those with former College/University Courses or from one of our Accredited Centers (Branch Campus) at the Graduate level may, if appropriate, complete a Transfer Credit Process at the time of initial application or as soon thereafter as possible. Please verify that courses have been completed at an accredited or Ministry-recognized University or equivalent, that the institution is specifically approved to offer graduate degrees, and that the course or courses is/are aligned in content and level with that/those offered at Universidad Azteca.
